private_information: Familiar with the high-level action vocabulary: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Can reason about preconditions and effects in causal sequences but does not author PDDL directly.
planner.goal: Propose a high-level sequence of actions to reach the goal conditions next object_12 object_6, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_11.

private_information: Specializes in checking temporal and causal consistency and removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens and post-hoc penalties.
Will identify implicit assumptions and flag or remove any shortcutting devices from plans and reports.
auditor.goal: Audit candidate plans and maps for causal and temporal correctness and produce a clean, bookkeeping-free assessment.

private_information: Collects and summarizes object attributes and observed relations such as hand, cats, texture, sneeze, spring, stupendous, vase, collect, and next.
Will not produce PDDL but provides a structured inventory of objects and relations.
mapper.goal: Produce an accurate inventory of objects, attributes, and currently true relations that other agents can rely upon.

private_information: Receives structured reports from planner, auditor, and mapper and integrates them into a final formal specification for a planner.
Responsible for producing a PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted at the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate inputs and output a consistent PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards that achieves the stated goal.

public_information: Action paltry requires preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, vase object_0 object_1, next object_1 object_2. Effects: add next object_0 object_2, delete vase object_0 object_1.
Action sip requires preconditions: hand object_0, cats object_1, texture object_2, next object_0 object_2, next object_1 object_2. Effects: add vase object_0 object_1, delete next object_0 object_2.

Action clip requires preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, next object_0 object_2. Effects: add vase object_0 object_1, delete next object_0 object_2.

Action wretched requires preconditions: sneeze object_0, texture object_1, texture object_2, stupendous object_3, next object_0 object_1, collect object_1 object_3, collect object_2 object_3. Effects: add next object_0 object_2, delete next object_0 object_1.
Action memory requires preconditions: cats object_0, spring object_1, spring object_2, next object_0 object_1. Effects: add next object_0 object_2, delete next object_0 object_1.

Action tightfisted requires preconditions: hand object_0, sneeze object_1, texture object_2, next object_1 object_2, vase object_0 object_1. Effects: add next object_0 object_2, delete vase object_0 object_1.

Initial facts: cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_9, next object_1 object_6, next object_12 object_11, next object_13 object_8, next object_14 object_8, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_10, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Goal facts: next object_12 object_6, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_11.
Notes: Do not rely on ad hoc bookkeeping tokens or post-hoc penalties. Plans must be causally grounded in explicit preconditions and effects.

analysis.system_prompt: You are a high-level planner. Read the public information and the known action schemata. Provide a sequenced, step by step high-level plan describing which actions to apply to which objects and why. Do not emit PDDL. Provide explicit mentions of any assumptions you rely upon.

audit.system_prompt: You are an auditor specialized in temporal and causal consistency. Inspect plans and reported assumptions and remove or flag any bookkeeping shortcuts, quota tokens, or post-hoc penalty devices. Provide a corrected, bookkeeping-free assessment and list of required corrections. Do not emit PDDL.

inventory.system_prompt: You are a mapper that inventories objects, attributes, and existing relations. From the public information produce a structured list of objects with their current attributes and the currently true binary relations. Highlight ambiguous or missing naming that could affect integration. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the planner, auditor, and mapper reports and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted at the FastDownwards solver. Ensure actions reflect the provided preconditions and effects and that no bookkeeping shortcuts remain. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions and predicates explicit and suitable for FastDownwards.
